data.event: The city of Austin was mapped out in 1862 by David Buell, and named after his partner, Alvah Austin during a silver rush reputedly triggered by a Pony Express horse who kicked over a rock.

event.title: was shifted to Battle Mountain in 1979

data.event: By summer 1863, Austin and the surrounding Reese River Mining District had a population of over 10,000, and it became the county seat of Lander County (the seat was shifted to Battle Mountain in 1979).
In 1864, the town launched Reuel Colt Gridley's impromptu fundraising drive that raised over $250,000 for wounded Civil War veterans, by repeatedly auctioning a sack of flour.
Major silver production ended by 1887, although there was a slight revival in the 1910s.
